website_summaries.verdict: An outstanding option for the vast majority of camping situations, MSR Groundhog tent stakes are reliable and stronger than you may expect.
pros: Set of 6 resilient aluminum tent stakes
Each features handy pull loop for easy removal
Y-shaped stakes are great for all kind of soil
Notched top for easy rope tying
cons: A relatively expensive set of tent stakes

customer_reviews.title: This seller gave me imitation MSR groundhog tent pegs
customer_reviews.text: These were not real MSR groundhogs. Got sent to copy don't like that. Pay top dollar for top quality. You can see that these are shorter and they do not have the propeller shape that the groundhogs do and are not marked groundhogs. Kind of seems like bait and switch. Big waste of my time.
customer_reviews.author: Crescenzo L.

customer_reviews.title: 4 Stars - One slight design flaw.
customer_reviews.text: Very good, could be slightly better. Pros: 1. Made of a very lightweight aluminum alloy. 2. Strong enough to stay straight when you're pounding them and they hit an underground rock. 3. The shape secures the stake is stable in a wide variety of terrains. 4. The paracord loops are strong and reliable. Cons: 1. The tip of the stakes do blunt a little when they hit underground rocks. 2. The notches on the top of the stake are straight, not hooked - so guylines are slightly less secure. Overall: These stakes live up to MSR's strong reputation. Extremely light for backpackers, and very effective in all terrains. However, MSR should have hooked (not straight) notches at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Honest ReviewerTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware - FAKE stakes!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware! Bought from seller INLOFF. Received totally fake, cheap knock-off stakes. They are shorter than actual MSR Groundhogs, and weren't labeled/branded with the MSR branding. They are also wider, clunker, and have rough edges. Nor do they have the propeller shape at the end like actual groundhogs. Hugely dissappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Twin Mom in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Not Groundhogs
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT MSR groundhogs. See branding and for that matter the cheap cordage. These are "shine trip" stakes ( whatever that means) Disgusted.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THESE
customer_reviews.text: Advertised and priced as MSR ground hog stakes and even labeled that way but the package contained $.88 Coghlan's stakes that are inferior quality. I missed the return window due to travel but this is nothing short of FRAUD.
customer_reviews.author: Aj King

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware - Not MSR Groundhog stakes!
customer_reviews.text: I contacted MSR when I received these stakes because I knew they were fakes. I was able to confirm that True MSR Groundhog stakes are stamped with the MSR Groundhog logo and have red reflective cordage. The stakes I received were cheap fakes... no logo and orange cordage! DO NOT BE FOOLED! MSR makes excellent products and the company doesn’t deserve getting negative reviews when the products being sold here are fakes! I didn’t think this kind of misrepresentation was allowed or legal for that matter. I did report this to MSR Corporate and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Proverbs31woman

customer_reviews.title: Knockoff!!!
customer_reviews.text: Received a set of knockoff with no logo or etching on the body. Find more trustworthy seller elsewhere!
customer_reviews.author: Jzzz

customer_reviews.title: Not MSR brand
customer_reviews.text: These are not MSR tent stakes, like the other reviewer said some no name brand called "ShineTrip". Very disappointed seller would mislead buyers like this.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Lemke

customer_reviews.title: Fake Stakes
customer_reviews.text: This is not a genuine MSR product. Knockoff stakes, be warned.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Great tent stakes and will last forever IF you take care of them
customer_reviews.text: If you are on loose dirt/muddy ground/regular soil these tent stakes are perfectly fine and incredibly lightweight. If you are on rock hard ground/very rocky terrain then you simply need to take the extra step of using your trowel to churn the dirt up where you want to put your stake in and remove any rocks. If you are on snow or sand you can use the eyelets on the stake to run some paracord through and anchor the stakes to a log/branch/decent sized rock which you then bury under the snow/sand. Follow those steps and your tent will be as secure as can be with a very low weight investment.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Limited Utility
customer_reviews.text: I used these camping in a forest clearing last night. The ground was pretty soft. These stakes were too short to hold the ground well. I can see that they maybe useful in different circumstance, like hard pack soil or rocky terrain. But for 90% of where I choose to pitch they won't work very well. I may carry them just incase I find myself in that kind of situation, but only if I am car camping and don't care about the extra weight. I'd up my rating if the seller here simply explained that they are not general purpose tent stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Stay in the ground better than other stakes, and more durable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my backpacking tent which I use at least once a month (if not more). Pros: -Design allows the stake to stay in the ground more securely than the "L" shaped stakes that are cheaper -Even if you happen to hit a rock under the surface while driving the stake into the ground, these do not bend or get warped like happens for cheaper stakes -Color makes it easy to find on the ground -Anodizing doesn't get worn off through repeated use as quickly as with other stakes Cons: -A bit more expensive, which may be a turn-off for some. I personally think the cost is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Honda

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to the hype!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, nice color, and strong. I got mine used from amazon warehouse, and they looked brand new. Like others have said, don't try to stick this into a rock or it will bend or break. I had that issue, as soon as I felt the rock...I stopped and repositioned and it was fine. use the little cord at the end to pull them out of the ground and should be fine. MSRP for me is a bit expensive, finds them on sale if you can and you will be even happier, or buy used to reduce waste.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Magoo

customer_reviews.title: They bend when you hammer them
customer_reviews.text: Why are you still reading this? Look at the picture, see that really narrow part near the top? Like narrower than other stakes sold as MSR groundhog stakes? That's where they bend. Bought other MSR groundhog stakes (without this narrower part ) at REI, and they work great. These do not work great, unless you are putting them in soft soil, in which case, maybe use fatter nylon stakes (?)
customer_reviews.author: Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Interesting design
customer_reviews.text: These are interesting 3-bladed tent pegs. The little loops make them really easy to remove and the extra blade make them harder to bend but they are made out aluminum and you can bend them trying to bang them into a rock with the back of a hatchet. That was operator error and I'm not going to remove a star for that, but we have tons of large rocks right below the surface of our normal camping haunts and all tent pegs have a rough existence around here. They're much more sturdy normal 2-bladed ones.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Only stakes to buy
customer_reviews.text: Nuff said - just buy them - you will not regret it. I camp a lot - when the weather hits you will be happy you have these. I've seem many tents lost due to the crap stakes that come with most gear - never lost one myself because I always use these !
customer_reviews.author: Apopleo

customer_reviews.title: Best performance to weight ratio stake
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used a lot of different stakes over the years, with the ultimate goal of lightest-usable. You’d think needle stakes would be lighter, but they aren’t - and are more subject to bending and breaking. Titanium might be stronger and shed mid better, but they don’t bite as well as these. I keep coming back to these because they are the best stake for traditional dirt (non-snow/sand) out there.
customer_reviews.author: Menudo Bandito

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight product
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on a six day backpack trip to Isle Royale. I'm slowly replacing everything heavy with something lighter. Or in this case something light with something lighter. My initial reaction was not positive when I pounded in the first stake and snapped the top off! However, when I went to remove the stack I realized that it was completely my fault as I had pounded it into a root and thus it was not a defect or issue with the stakes but with the user. After that all worked well and having the strings proves to be very useful as well.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Firmly Planted Stakes
customer_reviews.text: I bought a tent. It came with Shepard stakes. Those stakes were no match for the wind gusts of the high plains. Then I got MSR Groundhogs. I drove them through the surface layer of dirt. Then they hit rock..and went through that. My tent stayed staked out. The stakes are reflective with easy to pull out of ground loop. Do yourself and your tent mates a favor and get a set of Groundhogs.
customer_reviews.author: Ananke

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy but loops still slip off sometimes
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the stakes that came with my tent. Very sturdy and easy to pound into even packed ground (since you can use more force without bending them). However, I wish the notches were just a little deeper because I still get tent fly loops that release if shifting winds. Might be also a problem with the loop fasteners slipping a bit but still I think a more prominent notch would help. I would still recommend this product though.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: Authentic MSR, curved flanges, and stronger than Coughlans
customer_reviews.text: I've used the cheaper, Coughlans / Walmart / no-brand orange Y-stakes for years but finally upgraded to the standard setting Groundhog with its stronger metal (7075) and stronger, curved flanges. Pull cords are also good enough so I don't have to replace them. Pro-Tip -- don't hammer them in. If you can't find a rock, stick, or boot to press them in use a plastic bottle cap
customer_reviews.author: K. Sweere

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and durable but sharp edges on the heads make driving stakes into hard ground a painful experience. Flat line hooks have trouble staying attached to guy lines as well. Would NOT recommend. Prefer the more traditional "hook" head. Background: 30 years of backpacking and camping.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Great stakes, tough choice between the mini and full size.
customer_reviews.text: Great stakes. I went with the mini to save weight but the standard size would work fine. I am using there to replace a bend Nemo stake for my Galaxy tent just to hole the rainfly. If you are camping in windy areas or want to hold the body of the tent I recommend the full size. I will probably replace my main stakes with the full size ground hogs. There is a reason they are the go to for so many people. If you are debating, just buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S.

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes Weight Is Not The Absolute Deciding Factor
customer_reviews.text: I own 3 sets of stakes suitable for backpacking. The 6" titanium ones weigh just 0.2 ounces, each. The 6" Easton aluminum ones weigh 0.3 ounces, each, and the Groundhogs weigh 0.4 ounces, each. However with their greater surface area the Groundhogs hold way better than the titanium or Easton ones. A set of six pegs weighs 1.2 ounces more than 6 titanium ones. But they hold and are easier to find in the morning when you are breaking camp.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Wordy

customer_reviews.title: Top notch!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and strong. Also easy to pull out because you can’t sink these too deep. I’ve tried many stakes over the years and these are the best around. PERIOD! They do make a longer version if your camping in soft sand. Give your factory stakes away and go with these. You’ll have no regrets. Except for the initial cost maybe!
customer_reviews.author: ahiker4u

customer_reviews.title: The best stakes for backpacking.
customer_reviews.text: The groundhog minis are my go to stake. Throughout my years of ultralight backpacking I have tried all sorts of stakes. From the Coughlans plastic ones, to titanium shepherds hooks. The MSRs just hold up. They are a tiny bit heavier (a few grams) than the lightest option, but worth every bit of that weight in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Ryck

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed for our bags
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for our hiking packs. One set is plenty to setup a temp shelter for two people. The color is great and makes them easy to find. Each has a small cord attached but this is more for putting them all on a snaplink rather than securing a guide line to. Small so they all easily fit a small stuff sack.
customer_reviews.author: bluesy

customer_reviews.title: Was sent the regular, full size version, NOT the minis.
customer_reviews.text: As the headline says, I was sent the regular 7.5" version and not the mini, 6" version. The listing page on Amazon does indeed say "mini" but looking at the My Orders page, it does not. So somewhere Amazon messed up and needs to fix their listing. I'm sending these back. That said, they do seem like they should be sturdy and lightweight tent stakes, good for a lightweight backpacker. I'll be sure to leave a full product review when I receive the correct product.
customer_reviews.author: Angela H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent backpacking stakes
customer_reviews.text: Absolute best stakes for backpacking. Used for 10 days in the back country in NM. Didn't bend one in various terrains with various users (Boy Scouts) while i watched knock off brands fold under pressure. My only complaint is that someone swiped them from me ... I guess they liked them too. I'm replacing the "misplaced" set and replacing stakes provided with tent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KCW

customer_reviews.title: Great stakes
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set of MSR tent stakes that I've purchased. The first one was intended for testing. Now I'm sure that these are great stakes: light weight and durable. 0 bent stake after few hiking trips. Would be great if they came in a bag for stakes, but this is not a major issue and does not affect the number of stars :). P.S. amazon's picture is misleading, there are actually 8 stakes in the package and not 6 as on the picture.
customer_reviews.author: sk

customer_reviews.title: Best stakes ever!
customer_reviews.text: These stakes have been recommended by many of bushcrafters, hikers and campers. They sure do live up to the hype. They are lightweight (not titanium lightweight) and they are more durable than the stakes that came with my tent and tarp. I am buying more of these to replace the rest of the sub-par stakes I own.
customer_reviews.author: John Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good stakes, just some minor complaints
customer_reviews.text: Good stakes; durable and lightweight. I used these for a weeklong camping trip in southern Maryland and will use them again on the same trip. My only frustration with these is that it's harder to actually secure guylines with the notches being straight rather than hooked, as noted by a fellow reviewer. They did come out a few times during a blizzard/rainstorm, but I think that was due to user error rather than equipment failure.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: The Tent Stakes are Strong, light and long enough to hold the tent/tarps in place, during strong winds, as long as your not in extremely sandy territory. The areas that I camp in are normally rocky and damp soil and often hit a rock, or tree root, before it goes deep enough, but I've never had any problems with them bending, or distorting.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Lee

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: Love the lightweight stakes but doesn't take much to break one. The neck of the stakes is too fragile. Otherwise, they are awesome. We are very careful with our equipment but sometimes you have to use a small rock to get the stake in dry ground. It's easy for these to snap. I still recommend them though because of their weight. Once in, they work fine, although we have reinforced with rocks around them in serious wind.
customer_reviews.author: SusanO

customer_reviews.title: light weight durable visible
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for several years, and bought some more to keep with my new tent. They are twice expensive as the knockoffs, but these are made with 7000 series aluminum. You will not find pictures of snapped MSR grounhog stakes from hitting with a mallet, or due to wind sheer damage. These are also super easy to hand drive into most soils. Note: These are not "sand stakes". IMO, there is no such thing as a backpacking sand stake. Try sandbags.
customer_reviews.author: purveyor

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stakes, I've replaced all of my tent stakes with these! Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Glad I spent the money
customer_reviews.text: Never really used tent stakes before because they all suck and bend and not go in the ground. I had a backpacking trip planned and then started to call for heavy winds and storms and figured I should buy some. These were great. Easy to put in with out bending but came out of the ground with ease. Held my tent with the rain fly perfect. Also used them for a survive tent made out of a tarp and it help the tarp tight and with out sagging or blowing away in a very long rain. Spend the money and choose these. Very glad my tight A$$ sprung the extra money. 2 Friends order them after seeing me use them.
customer_reviews.author: Todd S.

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: These stakes are nice but I couldn’t use em. There isn’t enough of a hook or nook to hold a guild line in place. The one stake I banged in was very difficult to pull out... I actually damaged it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Rock-solid perfomer that does what it is designed to do perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Minimum weight, super strong and sturdy. Superior to single rod style aluminium or plastic stakes. Penetrates hard surface easy and anchors well in loose ground like sand when used correctly, i.e. perpendicular to the ground not at an angle. Super-light weight. Using it to secure my tents or rainflies on hum hammocks. Takes abuse well when pounded into ground with a mallet. Extracts with minimal effort using the attached rope sling. Highly recommend it. Great ground stake that last for many trips and applications.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoors Bushcraft

customer_reviews.title: The best tent stakes I've used so far!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Arizona and staking down a tent can be a painful process with the little metal tent stakes that come with your tent. The ground is usually pretty rocky, with a mixture of clay, so those metal stakes usually bend or don't go into the ground at all. When I tried these stakes a couple weekends ago, it was like hammering a stake into butter. Would recommend to anyone who lives in mountainous, rocky terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best tent stake on the market today. I've been a Scoutmaster for 23 years and have gone through dozens of different designs of tent stakes looking for the most perfect one out there: this is it. They can be bought for about $2 ea. If you look around you can find cheaper copies sold in different colors but unless you're buying them by the hundred as I am, it's not worth the search. The three sided design grabs the soil, placed sideways it hold in sand and snow. The anodized aluminum is very lightweight but drives into the hardest ground. ...and the lifetime warranty means you'll never have to pay for a tent stake ever again!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen N.

customer_reviews.title: very tiny
customer_reviews.text: purchased the mini by mistake very tiny about the size of a pencil...was going to use as solar light stakes but too tiny. i have some tiny air gun metal silhouette targets and they come with pre drilled holes for tying them down. these stakes have a pre drilled hole and will work great for tying them off and staking them down .they really fly when you hit them. so i do not have to hunt for them or lose any.
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.title: Great stakes
customer_reviews.text: I've used Groundhog stakes for years, have some older version 6" that work great as well. As long as you apply common sense in during placement and removal, they will hold up great. I pretty much trust anything from MSR.
customer_reviews.author: AspenSnowman

customer_reviews.title: Light and stout
customer_reviews.text: Used these to anchor down our roof top tent in an unexpected wind storm. I had forgot the stakes that came with the tent at home. Had these in my back pack. Super light. I was concerned they were to small to do the job but they worked out great.
customer_reviews.author: richard

customer_reviews.title: Trip saver
customer_reviews.text: So glad I had these for a recent trip to Colorado where the ground was rock hard. The tent stakes that came with my northface stormbreak 2 bent. I will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit thru standard grommet holes
customer_reviews.text: These stakes are useless. They do not fit thru a standard grommet hole on a ground tarp. Discovered this right after the return window closed.
customer_reviews.author: sdath

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: High quality stakes without a doubt. Purchased for my hammock set up and did not disappoint. A little on the pricy side compared to some other China brands, but did not want to sacrifice quality. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Drilldoctor13

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent Stake for tough ground
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stake over a year ago. The stakes that came with my tent were not substantial enough for the type of camping I do. So I had to find a stake that would hold in very wet rainy weather as well as ground that was hard packed and would bend most thick wire type stakes. These stakes have held through three days of torrential rain and wind where other tents near by had collapsed. I have also used them to stake out my 10' x 10' shade canopy on the beach so the wind doesn't carry it away. So if you are looking for a good ground stake I would highly recommend giving this one a try.
customer_reviews.author: J. Holloway

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight, high grip stakes.
customer_reviews.text: They're easy to remove, but then again they're not. Isn't that the point? I've pushed them in and hammered em in and they hold up. Just don't side load, read kick back and forth to wallow out the hole so you can pull em out.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: I ordered these to go with the tent we bought ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to go with the tent we bought...they always seem to come up missing when we have them. Although the other tents always have them in green or silver and they so not seem to stick out as much. The red definitely makes it easier to see.
customer_reviews.author: SHERRY M DAUGHERTY

customer_reviews.title: Full-Size, not "Mini" Groundhogs!
customer_reviews.text: These are not the "Mini" Groundhog stakes. They are the Full-Size 7.5" inch stakes. Still great stakes, but I needed the actual 6" Mini-version.
customer_reviews.author: Kynthano

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and sturdy tent stakes.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, sturdy, reliable. These are my “go to” camping stakes. I have tried lighter weight stakes...they folded like butter. Will stick with these from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Jemini W.

customer_reviews.title: Great stakes, they took a beating
customer_reviews.text: Great stakes, they took a beating, being driven into very dry ground with the back end of an axe/hammer. Don't be afraid to hit them hard, they can take it. I want to buy some more. Defiantly stronger than the Shepard hooks. I read reviews of people having trouble pulling the out. I learned really quick that if you put some kind of handle through the rope, from like a hammer/axe handle, and give it a couple good tugs, they will come out. Be careful not to move the rope to much on the tugs, the rope will fray and tare. And then you are screwed. Have fun and happy camping.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest

customer_reviews.title: Most durable tent stakes, about same price as REI
customer_reviews.text: My sons and myself have never bent a MSR ground hog stake despite using them about 300+ nights of BSA camping. They are about $0.50 less expensive at REI in Dallas
customer_reviews.author: Jason Emmons Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Yep, was a shepherds hook fan until I met these.
customer_reviews.text: Yep, was a TI shepherds hook fan until I met these. All I can say is WOW... these things hold. 3 nights in sand and MANY days in the dirt and I HAVE YET to see these things slip. I bought the 6 pack, and while they are a little pricey, they are well worth it. If your going ultralight, go with the TI shepherds hooks, but even I'll accept the few extra grams for these things. They just DO NOT SLIP.
customer_reviews.author: SvenTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: The strongest, best holding stake I've used
customer_reviews.text: These stakes might not be the lightest stakes on the market, but they hold in the ground like no other stake I've used. I use these GroundHog stakes to pitch my tarp over my hammock. I have used these stakes when camping in windy and rainy conditions and they have held in the ground in gusting winds, up to 40 mph. They are easy to push into the dirt by using the sole of my shoe to press them into the ground. I'm confident that they won't bend or break. I don't think you could go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: Danger031

customer_reviews.title: The Best Sturdy Stakes
customer_reviews.text: These are a bit pricey, I got 8 in a pack but they are the best I've seen yet. No more bending the stakes that is for certain. Depending on your tent you may wish to order two sets. These are as durable as they get folks, they work in the harsh desert ground and even in sand and ice. Check to see if you need more than 8 for your tent it is a worthy investment. You get what you pay for and if you want stakes that will last a lifetime then here they are. I highly recommend them and they do come with the lanyards already attached.
customer_reviews.author: Zavi Rasan

customer_reviews.title: So light, and so strong...
customer_reviews.text: These stakes are perfect for the job. Properly placed, they will secure a 16x16 Kelty Noah's Tarp through high winds.Even 7.5 feet off the ground when it basically became a sail. Two adjustable poles were bent in half, but the stakes held firm. MSR makes AWESOME products. These stakes are now a permanent addition to my camping gear.
customer_reviews.author: Jerl

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but worth it.  Lightweight, sturdy.  Best I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best tent stakes I've owned. Light, durable & easily go into rocky ground where standard tent stakes would bend or break. Their triangular design gives them extra grip so they won't be sliding back out of the ground. I worried that the heads were going to be too small to hold the tent guidelines, but they're notched just right so they hold. They're expensive, but I expect that these will last for many years to come. Plus they're red! Ok, so I love red, but honestly, they are easier to see in the ground than some others I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and rugged construction. I think I'll be very pleased with these stakes. Just as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bledsoe

customer_reviews.title: Nice stake
customer_reviews.text: These are great I got them for my footprint and they serve their purpose well I like that they are orange so they're easy to see easy to put into the ground hold well I'm fairly easy to pull out
customer_reviews.author: Wilderness1022

customer_reviews.title: Very High Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent choice for camping/backpacking. Lightweight but very sturdy. Design makes them very easy to put into the ground even when the ground is hard/compact.
customer_reviews.author: IL Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use in hard ground
customer_reviews.text: All of them broke the first time trying to remove from hard ground. The regular hooks work great so just use them going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Jerssmith

customer_reviews.title: Stakes that hold my tarp
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my hammock setup. Stakes hold well. I removed cordage that came attached and added shock cord loops to tie to. Lightweight stakes that do the job.
customer_reviews.author: victoria emery

customer_reviews.title: My go-to tent stakes
customer_reviews.text: I got a Nemo tent and, while I love them, the stakes are way too heavy. THESE are what I replace tent stakes with. Compact, lightweight, and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works great, wish I purchased the longer length for the sandy beach I go to. The is quality good and works perfect up in the mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Ikaika Simpliciano

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent stakes
customer_reviews.text: Nice tent stakes. I used them with my Hubba footprint and extra tie downs on my Hubba NX. The loops at the end of the stake make it easy to remove from the ground, but there's no ideal way to secure the stake to the tether you're trying to stake to the ground. If all there used for is to create tension, these work fine, but not so much as a stake. I liked them though and they served me well for my purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Laher

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy!
customer_reviews.text: These tent stakes are outstanding for backpacking and shave a lot of weight off the load. I used these stakes on a two man tent and for my hammock. Perfect for staking down tents, rain flies, and guy lines. It's hard to believe how strong and light these are.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Should work good
customer_reviews.text: I love the ones I received. I ordered regular ground hog stakes, and received mini ground hog stakes. Not a big deal,just gonna accept it. Only a 4 rating for sending the wrong ones. EDITED: 2nd order I received 8,(not the advertised 6) for half the price, very happy about that. These are much bigger than mini g.h stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Zwick

customer_reviews.title: Digging these stakes
customer_reviews.text: Held beautifully - almost too good. Needed my pliers on my multitool to pull them out but great stakes that didn't bend and held strong throughout the night.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick H

customer_reviews.title: Great for rocky ground!
customer_reviews.text: These are great tent stakes! They will cut through some hard ground and really hold well.
customer_reviews.author: KBD

customer_reviews.title: Tough
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these for the past two years and I camp fairly often, I have put them in sand, hard pack dirt and everything in between. They do become dull, but that’s to be expected, I have had the ropes untie and have had to re tie them but they keep going and going. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: s.c.

customer_reviews.title: The best ive used, the only ill ever use.
customer_reviews.text: First let me say that i first bought these because I was tired of bending the flimsy groubd stakes that come with tents, even high end one. That issue does not exist with these. They drove into the ground with minimal force and stayed put through 6 days of with torrential down poors and winds with gusts up to 45 mph. After that they came out easy and clean. Oh did i mention that there much lighter than traditional ground stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Adventure Dave

customer_reviews.title: STOP dealing with s***ty tent stakes
customer_reviews.text: Best $15 camping investment I've ever made. These stakes are strong, sharp, and functional. You can stomp them into the hardest soil with your foot with no worries about them bending. The cord loop makes pulling them out a BREEZE, and also allows you to easily attach other cords and lines to the stakes. These are an absolute essential for anyone who camps with a tent.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Moody

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Very light and appear to be sturdy. Great for backpacking trips where weight matters.
customer_reviews.author: Soren Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Best and baddest
customer_reviews.text: For most conditions, these smaller profile stakes are excellent. Lightweight and compact.
customer_reviews.author: King Cormack

customer_reviews.title: The worlds best tent stakes!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'll never use another brand of tent stakes ever again! Light, durable, extremely strong, reliable and easy to use. Held my Kelty tent in winds that other stakes would have failed and did!!! Buy a set today!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Sarc

customer_reviews.title: It's unfortunate they stole this very good design. I would like the head to be ...
customer_reviews.text: You can buy very similar stakes now for a lot cheaper at a big box retailer. It's unfortunate they stole this very good design. I would like the head to be slightly larger.
customer_reviews.author: Phil The Backpacker

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Nice and light weight, used them on a crossing trip on New Zealand. Held up well.
customer_reviews.author: SMD

customer_reviews.title: Great balance of price, weigh, and strength
customer_reviews.text: These are way better than the normal stakes that come with many tents. The angles make them much less likely to bend. The cord makes them easy to pull. They are light and functional. Of course, titanium will be a bit lighter, but I figured that if I spit a couple times before starting a hike, I've made up the difference:)
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: My favorite stake - takes abuse and keeps on holding
customer_reviews.text: I have a mix of different ground stakes, various aluminum and titanium hooks, and these are my favorite. They are very strong, it took me a lot of effort to bend one by pounding it with a rock into a rock buried in the ground. It then got lodged into the rock and took me a good 30 minutes to dig it out. The cord loops aren't very strong and can break with enough pressure. It takes a lot of effort to bend one. They hold in soft or hard ground, and are easy to loop cord around.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: My Goto tent stake
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for years and needed some extra for another tent and a tarp. These are durable and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Tech junkie

customer_reviews.title: Fake product! Not real MSR ground stakes. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Fake product! These are not real MSR ground stakes. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Nick dehaan

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and beefy
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and strong as hell. Do yourselves a favor and toss the stakes included with you tent and replace them with these MFs
customer_reviews.author: Poster89

customer_reviews.title: Strong stakes, but light.
customer_reviews.text: Great stakes. Durable, light. No twisting in ground, no bent stakes here. Love these stakes.
customer_reviews.author: M2E2S

customer_reviews.title: By far the best tent stakes I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: By far the best tent stakes I have ever used. My carbon fiber and titanium stakes are lighter, but they don't hold nearly as well as the Groundhogs. I have used them successfully in both sandy ground and rocky soil. They hold better than typical tent stakes in sand, but can still come loose easier than a larger sand stake or anchor. I have had no problems pounding them in the ground with a rock (since I never bring any sort of mallet or hammer). The rope loop makes them easy to remove with my hands or a stick.
customer_reviews.author: Shuttlekat

customer_reviews.title: Where is strong material
customer_reviews.text: I think every tent or anything that you want to tie down to ground needs these pics are adorable light and indestructible .
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I feel as though these will break easily and should carry a couple of spares
customer_reviews.text: difficult to stake into hard packed campsites. I feel as though these will break easily and should carry a couple of spares, which defeats some of the weight savings. I doubt there is any such thing as a "perfect" tent stake.
customer_reviews.author: Valued Customer

customer_reviews.title: worked
customer_reviews.text: held the tent down in 40+ mph wind. poles broke but pegs stayed. wish there was an 8 pack ... that's what i needed.
customer_reviews.author: dwaine h.

customer_reviews.title: cord is retroreflective so they're easy to see in the dark (if there's any light ...
customer_reviews.text: cord is retroreflective so they're easy to see in the dark (if there's any light source) very sturdy, i unknowingly hammered one into sandstone and it was fine after pulling it out. only downside is the hook on the top is small, and just a notch cut into the top. a taut line stays anchored well, but changing wind directions causes a slack line to come unhooked.
customer_reviews.author: thelantz

customer_reviews.title: Worked Fine At The Beach During Storms
customer_reviews.text: These worked well for my daughter on a recent camping trip to Delaware Seashore Park. They weathered several storms with no problems. I bought them because this was her and her friends first camping trip on their own and I wanted to make sure the tent was well staked. It was. BTW, they were using an older Eureka Equinox tent, which has a fairly large profile. Of course I made sure she used all of the available storm guys etc.
customer_reviews.author: D. H. Schmid

customer_reviews.title: Only for the true camper
customer_reviews.text: Don't get this if you're car camping or not serious about camping and saving weight needing high performance. The rods you get with your tent are more than good enough. If you need the quality stakes, can't afford to deal with a bent metal peg, or need to go through super-hard ground, this is the stake for you. I don't give it five stars because of the price. They must pump these out at 20 cents each at the plant.
customer_reviews.author: Phil B.

customer_reviews.title: Look very strong and tough
customer_reviews.text: First: I haven't actually used these yet, but, WOW! These things are nice. They seem tough as compared to the pegs that came with my tent and being an inch longer would stand to reason they'll hold better. The "Y" design of the body seems very stable and I look forward to using them soon. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: BillZ

customer_reviews.title: They are worth their weight in aluminum.
customer_reviews.text: These are some of my favorite stakes. They hold very well, given how easy they are to put in the ground and take them out when needed. The attached string helps a lot. If I have an issue pushing one in, I am not afraid to use a rock to pound them, or use my handy PVC "T" to push them in. After 3 years, I have not broken one yet.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the job they do holding the tent and ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pack of these to go with my MSR Hubba Hubba tent for a week long PCT hike with my son. Day 2 my son was in charge of packing tent and left them in a bag at our first camp site. We made due with rocks the rest of the week but I bought another pack upon returning and have used them for over a year. Very happy with the job they do holding the tent and lines in different soil. They are still as strait as the day they came out of the package. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Jason J. Mosiman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Work great over Memorial day weekend, we had a high desert thunderstorm in Arizona with 50 MPH winds and the Groundhogs didn't budge an inch. A little pricey, but I think it is worth it, would definitely buy again. on another area I had to pound them into some really hard pack, the normal hammer I use in most areas wouldn't drive them, so I found a big rock/small boulder and got them in with that, didn't bend any of them
customer_reviews.author: Richard Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Hold well. Lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Great stakes. Hold well and are light weight. Hard to pull out but thats why they hold well.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: Great price and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight extra stakes. These stay in my tent back for emergencies. They're lightweight but strong. I wouldn't advise hitting them to get them in the ground as I think they would bend rather easily. I have not used them in rough weather or rocky areas, but they have replaced my old stakes that bent under minimal pressure. Great price too! Beats REI.
customer_reviews.author: Jess E.

customer_reviews.title: Its hard to leave behind these tent stakes
customer_reviews.text: We ordered about 30 of these tent stakes for a big Scouting trip to Philmont and the lightness, color and attached cord were all extremely helpful. I think we only left one behind. The rest of the stakes were easily recovered each morning of our 10 day trek. Great design!!
customer_reviews.author: William G

customer_reviews.title: Super light and strong
customer_reviews.text: Wow these things really hold well and are much lighter than I expected. I used them on a backpacking trip and was very pleased with their function. They went into the ground easily, but held firmly. Removing them wasn't much trouble, though. They feel very strong and really are amazingly light. I think an 8 pack will be enough for me, but I'd buy more without hesitation. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J. Marble

product_meta.title: MSR Groundhog Tent Stake Kit
product_meta.description: The MSR Groundhog Tent Stake Kit is a serious gear closet upgrade, with six lightweight and durable camping and backpacking tent stakes that hold up to repeated pounding into a variety of ground types. The three-sided Y-beam design offers superior penetration and holding power, ensuring that tents stay securely staked out, even in rough weather. A notch at the top hooks tent guy lines, and the attached reflective pull loop allows for easy removal of stakes when it’s time to pack up camp. The MSR Groundhog Tent Take Kit includes six individual tent stakes. Available in two sizes; each Regular tent stake weighs 0.46 ounces, and measures 7.5 inches long, and each Mini tent stake weighs 0.35 ounces and meansures 6 inches. Manufacturer’s limited 3-year warranty.
feature_bullets: 6-pack of lightweight, durable, and versatile camping and backpacking tent stakes that stay put
Three-sided Y-beam design offers superior penetration and holding power in a variety of soil types
Notch at top for securing guy lines; attached reflective pull loop allows for easy removal
Constructed from 7000-series aluminum; stakes are lightweight, yet rugged
Includes six individual tent stakes; each tent stake weighs 0.46 ounces, and measures 7.5 inches long
